places.generalDescription: Lover's Leap Waterfall, found about 3 kilometers from Nuwara Eliya town, is a stunning 30-meter high waterfall with a tragic love story attached to its name. It originates from Piduruthalagala, Sri Lanka's highest mountain, and cascades down a steep cliff surrounded by typical highland vegetation. The water is collected for drinking purposes and during dry spells, the flow slows down.

sources.snippet: About a half-hour walk from the center of Nuwara Eliya, you‚Äôll find Lover‚Äôs Leap Waterfall. According to folklore, the name comes from a tragic love story about a prince and his beloved who, due to their forbidden love, jumped to their end together from this waterfall. Despite this sad but romantic story, it is definitely a beautiful waterfall to visit.

sources.snippet: This picturesque waterfall is not only known for its natural beauty but also for the romantic legend associated with it. According to local folklore, a young couple, unable to be together due to societal pressures, leapt from the top of the waterfall. Hence the waterfall‚Äôs unique name.

places.name: Lover's Leap Waterfall

reviews.text: The waterfall is beautiful but there are many around Sri Lanka like this. What made my experience 5* was a local guide called Yoga. He was waiting near the top, on the approach to the bottom of the waterfall, and asked if I wanted to see the hidden waterfalls. As a solo female traveller, I was a little hesistant to go into the jungle with him, but I'd seen a review from someone on here about their experience so I decided to go ahead. He also spoke Tamil, so I could communicate well with him. It was the best decision ever! We hiked through the jungle and discovered so many hidden waterfalls. He took plenty of photos for me and we ended up at the top of the Lover's Leap Waterfall, looking down on everyone else! It was a surreal experience that lasted about 2 hours. Just a little warning that it was physically challenging, but Yoga helped me climb the larger rocks. I wasn't really sure how much to give him in return for his time as he doesn't request a specific amount, but ended up deciding on 10,000LKR as I was on a budget trip. He told my that past tourists had given him his camera phone too. So sweet!

The waterfall is beautiful, but has nothing unique. There are lots of similar waterfalls in mountain region of Sri Lanka.
Although this one is easily accessible through scenic road among picturesque tea estates.
Also there is a good view to the town.

A hidden gem tucked away in the hills. The walk through the tea estate to reach the waterfall is calm and peaceful, with fresh air and stunning green views all around. The sound of the water grows louder as you approach, and the sight of the falls against the backdrop of rolling hills is just magical. A perfect spot to relax, take photos, and enjoy nature at its best.

places.generalDescription: Bomburu Ella Waterfall is a stunning group of around twelve waterfalls located in the Nuwara Eliya District, near Hakgala Botanical Gardens. The main cascade can be reached on a hike of less than a mile from the car park in Perawella and is one of the widest waterfalls in Sri Lanka. It's not crowded with tourists, making it a rewarding half-day excursion from Nuwara Eliya.

sources.snippet: Right outside Nuwara Eliya town, there is a very scenic spots where a lot of tuk tuk and taxi drivers stop to show a view of Bomburu Ella Waterfall and Bomburuella reservoir. You can enjoy the view from the road or, if you are adventurous then you can actually visit. Bomburu Ella Waterfall is situated between Welimada and Nuwara Eliya in Sita Eliya Kandapola Forest Reserve.

sources.snippet: This place is STUNNING and it is only 30 minutes away from the heart of Nuwara Eliya. The amount of greenery and different platforms leading up to the waterfall make for some sweet pictures‚Äìshowing just how big and powerful the waterfall actually is. The foot of Bomburu Ella is also a very relaxing place without many tourists.

reviews.text: The Water Falls was majestic with large amount of water during April 2025. It was raining a little. The Falls' landing seemed dangerous with protruding rocks everywhere. Caution recommended. The environment looks stunning, enjoy in distance. It was sliightly over-crowded during a Sunday. The tracking trail was dangerous and slippery. Take a water bottle for you and take the empty back. Keep an umbrella. Do not get fed-up seeing the first two hundred steep steps. The walk worth the experience.

Local ticket price 100 per person ( Adult )
There are many food stalls on both sides of the road. To see the waterfall, you need to climb a small hike for about 2 km. This is the most beautiful waterfall in Sri Lanka. The area is clean, with lots of beautiful flowers and insects.
